alert.note: Alert for Pleasants; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 3:32PM EST until February 21 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Pleasants and Tyler. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 327 PM EST, the automated gauge at Middle Island Creek at Little had crested at 14.78 ft and is falling. The current stage is 14.51 ft. At stages above 14 feet, the field opposite of the gauge as well as Stewarts Run Road floods. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of West Central Tyler and Northeastern Pleasants Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
